page.title: 13VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: When you are out of the village there are two landmarks which stand out. These are the two new pit head winding towers, replacing the old ones which had been there for many years. The Anglican Church of St. Wilfriths is not the only church in the village, there are three more. These are the Roman Catholic, The Spiritualist and the Jehovas Witness'. All the churches are quite well attended and for a small village, hardly anyone is left out. Not far from the pit there is a recreation ground. It has a apark for children, a cricket pitch, a golf course, two bowling greens, a rugby pitch, a grand stand and three practise pitches. There are some allotments, for people with green fingers, between the South of the village and the Moors.
